unnormalised: RBI has been quite proactive lately, no? Word on the street is they're cracking down on those with multiple accounts linked to the same PAN. Apparently, some folks are using multiple bank accounts and demat accounts to game the system, which is def not cool. It’s like, you shouldn’t have 10 accounts all under PAN: ABCDE1234F, right?
normalised: R-B-I has been quite proactive lately, no? Word on the street is they're cracking down on those with multiple accounts linked to the same P-A-N. Apparently, some folks are using multiple bank accounts and demat accounts to game the system, which is definitely not cool. It's like, you shouldn't have ten accounts all under P-A-N: A-B-C-D-E one two three four F, right?

unnormalised: Plus, there's talk about tightening norms around IFSC codes too. Remember that scam a few years back? Yeah, RBI's probably trying to prevent anything like that from happening again. My CA friend was saying something about mandatory Aadhar linking to all accounts to verify against the UIDAI database - maybe that’s next?

unnormalised: Speaking of linking, mutual fund houses are also being extra careful. They’re sending out reminders left and right to link your Aadhar to your investments and update your KYC. My cousin got like, 3 emails about his folio no. 123456789! Annoying, but better safe than sorry, I guess.
normalised: Speaking of linking, mutual fund houses are also being extra careful. They’re sending out reminders left and right to link your Aadhar to your investments and update your K-Y-C. My cousin got like, three emails about his folio number one two three four five six seven eight nine! Annoying, but better safe than sorry, I guess.

unnormalised: All in all, it's good to see them keeping things in check. Keeps the financial system more stable and prevents fraud. Just make sure your stuff is in order, and you’ll be fine! Check your CIBIL score (something like 750+) while you’re at it. Always good to know where you stand.
